column4: hi.. i tried installing g++ and tried to run a program in ubuntu but i keep getting this error http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/15357.. can somebody PLEASE help me solve this..
its a C++ simple program that uses a vector.. do you want to see the code
this is the code i ran http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/15358
honestly I have no idea what you are trying to do
Oh! i am writing a program that has a function which creates a STL vector int and returns it..
its prolly reacting to the garbage in the memory address
why don't you just do vector<int> a; a.push_back(1); a.push_back(2);
OK that works.. probably sth wrong with the code
I could have told you that immeadiatly :P
I can fix it to do what you want...
thanks for your help.. i was breaking my head for the past hour thinking sth was wrong with g++ :P:P
ok i will try that.. thanks a lot
